abstract: The chipmaker said that first-quarter net income fell 55 percent to $647 million, or 11 cents a share, on revenue of $7.1 billion.
snippet: The chipmaker said that first-quarter net income fell 55 percent to $647 million, or 11 cents a share, on revenue of $7.1 billion.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  In another sign that the worst of the economic downturn might have passed, Intel said on Tuesday that the personal computer industry had bottomed out in the first quarter of the year.

headline.main: Intel Says PC Sales Have Reached a Bottom and Forecasts Moderate Growth
headline.print_headline: Intel Says PC Sales Have Reached a Bottom and Forecasts Moderate Growth
